properties.sfomuseum:description: Interviewed on July 7, 2021The interview describes the life and career of Mark Johnson, who served in the United States Army from 1977 to 1981, then flew helicopters in the private sector until 1989, when he joined the San Francisco Fire Department and retired as Assistant Deputy Chief of the SFO Airport Division in 2021; childhood in San Francisco; decision to join the Army; training and service; decision to leave the Army; work as a helicopter pilot; decision to join San Francisco Fire Department; initial training; experiences and observations of racial prejudice in the Department and overall improvements over time; experiences as a firefighter in San Francisco; advancement through the ranks of the department; training and operational software improvements he designed; experiences working with the SFO Airport division; differences between airport and city firefighting; anecdotes about work in both areas; experience of management within the department; observations of sexism and homophobia; relationship between Black Firefighters Association and the department, particularly the local union over the years; role of other affinity groups within the department; experiences of mentorship; effects of his work on his family life and health; and the impact of his work on his life.
properties.sfomuseum:subject: San Francisco International Airport (Calif.)San Francisco (Calif.) Fire DepartmentFire fighters—United StatesFire fighters—Labor unionsAfrican American fire fightersUnited States. Army—Military life
properties.wof:name: oral history transcript: Assistant Deputy Chief Mark Johnson
